summary: This document is the Third Amendment to the Restated Trust of Jeffrey E. Epstein, detailing the distribution of trust assets upon his death. It specifies amounts to be distributed to various individuals, including Jean Luc Brunel and Luciano Fontanillo, and outlines the powers of the trustees during Epstein's lifetime.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Jean Luc Brunel is named as a beneficiary of the trust, set to receive $2,000,000 if he is living at the time of distribution.

persons.name: Luciano Fontanillo

keyFacts: The trust was amended to include specific distributions upon the death of the Grantor.
Jean Luc Brunel is set to receive $2,000,000 from the trust if he is living at the time of distribution.
Luciano Fontanillo is set to receive $1,000,000 and has all loans forgiven by Epstein.
The document was executed on April 5, 2007.
The trust allows the trustees to pay income and principal to the Grantor during his lifetime.
